alert.note: Alert for Eastern Las Animas County; Las Animas Vicinity, Bent County; Springfield Vicinity, Baca County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 11:16PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Baca, northeastern Las Animas and south central Bent Counties through 1145 PM MDT... At 1116 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 22 miles northwest of Pritchett, or 30 miles northwest of Springfield, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Baca, northeastern Las Animas and south central Bent Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Pueblo.
